law.catch_line: Wrongfully entering park and injuring or killing deer, elk or buffalo -- Treble damages.
law.text: Any person who wrongfully breaks or enters a park or other enclosed grounds used for keeping deer, elk or buffalo, or hunts, drives, chases, takes out, maims or kills any deer, elk or buffalo therein shall, in addition to any other penalty, also pay to the person aggrieved treble the amount of damages sustained.
law.history: Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 49, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1980.
